Common Red Flags

The new Internal Routines and Controls and Fraud Review: Examiner Reference Tool is designed to help you pursue fraud risk during examinations. For each task, the tool identifies initial fraud indicators, relevant examination procedures to pursue fraud risks, and red flags that suspicious activity is occurring. Throughout this course, we will reference this tool to get you in the habit of using it. As an abbreviation, we will refer to this tool as the Examiner Reference Tool.

Some of the most common red flags include the following:

  • Same individual has control of transaction from start to finish,
  • Lack of segregation of duties, dual controls, or rotation of duties,
  • Drastic reduction in delinquencies/overdrafts at month end,
  • Lending in excess of limits,
  • Inadequate management review of dormant accounts,
  • Unsupported expensive lifestyles,
  • Inadequate reconcilements,
  • Weak internal controls,
  • Inadequate audit reviews or scope,
  • Dominant executives, and
  • Lack of management response to audit findings or employee concerns.
